c:complexType.name: DimensionType
c:complexType.c:documentation: The options documentation class of a dimension type.

c:property.name: label
c:property.c:documentation:
The name of the dimension type as it is shown to the user.
The label should be unique.
The default value is built from the dimension name, by converting the first character to upper case.

c:property.name: valueType
c:property.c:documentation: The type of value that dimensions of this type will hold.

c:property.name: isDiscrete
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if a dimension type should be considered discrete or continuous.
Only dimension types whose is one of or
can be continuous.
Some chart types support binding a continuous or a discrete dimension to a visual role, yielding different visual results. An example is the "color" visual role of the Metric Line/Dot charts. Another example is the Line/Dot/Area chart that supports both a continuous or a discrete dimension in its "category" visual role.
The default value dependends on the value of . If it can be continuous, then the default value is false. If it cannot, the default value is true.

c:property.name: converter
c:property.c:documentation:
Converts a non-null raw value, as read from the data source, into a value of the dimension's .
The returned value need not have the type of the dimension's value type. Yet, it must be such that the associated value type's cast function can convert it to the dimension's value type. In this way, only "non-standard" conversions need to be handled with a converter function.
Values that are not convertible by the dimension's value type cast function become null.
Also, note that the only value type that does not have a cast function is the .
When unspecified and the value type is , and the option is specified a default converter is created for it.

c:property.name: rawFormat
c:property.c:documentation:
A protovis format string that is to parse the raw value.
Currently, this option is ignored unless the option is unspecified and the value type is .
When the chart option , is specified, and the value type is , it is taken as the default value of this option.
A converter function is created to parse raw values with the specified format string.

c:property.name: key
c:property.c:documentation:
A function that converts a non-null value of the dimension's
into a string that (uniquely) identifies the value in the dimension.
The default key function is the standard JavaScript String function, and is suitable for most value types.
If the dimension's value type is one of or
the String function may not be suitable to identify the values.
If more than one value has a given key, only the first one will be stored in the dimension.

c:property.name: comparer
c:property.c:documentation:
A function that compares two different and non-null values of the dimension's .
When unspecified, a default natural order comparer function is applied to the continuous value types: and .
Dimension types that do not have a comparer function "compare" their values by "input order" - order of first appearance, in the data source.

c:property.name: formatter
c:property.c:documentation:
A function that formats a value, possibly null, of the dimension's .
Note that, the chart option , is used to build a default formatter function for numeric dimensions of the "value" dimension group.
When unspecified and the value type is , a default formatter is created that formats numbers with two decimal places.
When unspecified and the value type is , and the option is specified (or implied) a default formatter is created for it.
Otherwise a value is formatted by calling the standard JavaScript String function on it.

c:property.name: format
c:property.c:documentation:
The dimension type's format provider.
When the option is specified, this one is ignored.
When a string, it is the mask of the or formats, depending on the dimension's the dimension's , of a new format provider that replaces the current one.
When a function, it is the formatter of the or custom formats, depending on the dimension's the dimension's , of a new format provider that replaces the current one. Note that specifying a function to this property is equivalent to specifying .
When an object is specified, it configures the current format object.
Alternatively, a direct instance of , can be specified, replacing the existing format provider. Instead, specifying , , or configures the existing format provider.
A protovis format string that is to format a value of the dimension's .
When unspecified, and the dimension type's value type is , and the property is specified, a format string is derived from the later by replacing the "-" character with a "/" character.
Otherwise, the dimension type's format provider inherits its property values from the chart's format provider.

c:property.name: isHidden
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if values of this dimension type should be hidden from the user.
This option is useful to hide auxiliar dimensions that are used to:
hold extra data, required for drill-down purposes
complete the minimal working information a chart needs to work, like, for example, a "series" dimension created automatically by a chart if its required "series" visual role was not unbound
The only place where the values of a dimension that is not bound to a visual role are shown to the user is the tooltip, as it is formatted by default. To prevent this, set the dimension type's isHidden option to true.
